instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Liquid damaged by the LVDS connecter. Can't see anything anywhere else. Already replaced u7000 and q7085 

on U7000
Pin1 = 0v
pin2 = 17.5v
pin3 = 4.2v
pin9 = 0v
pin12 = 3.47v
pin14= 3v
pin 15 = 0.3v
pin17 = 12.54v
pin19 = 5v
pin20= 5v
pin27 = 17.5

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H looks good, no need to work on U7000 area.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
3v3_S5 is pulsing like crazy. 0 - 3.3V

3v3_SUS is pulsing as well but from 0 - 1v and then 0 - 0.04v

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: PP5V_S5 is pulsing on u7200. but PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS is stable of course

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Am I correct in thinking. If a 5V line has issues and a 3V line has issues, there's no point looking at the 3V line since it's produced by the 5V anyway and the issue is most likely with the 5V?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Do you get pulse at the other big coils?

SMC may detect a short/overcurrent and cycles the power.
Check if something changes in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
actually I just realised PPBUS also pulses but not strong. Every few seconds it'll go down to 12.3 and then back to 12.56

so L7030 is actually pulsing and so is L3895

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
"Check if something changes in SMC bypass mode."
???

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
SMC_PM_G2_EN is pulsing; confirm that.

Make short over R7271 and check if L7220 gets stable voltage.
If not, make short over R7272 and check if SMC_PM_G2_EN fluctuates.

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
SMC_PM_G2_EN is pulsing yep

made short over R7271 and L7220 is now stable.
Board is drawing more power now, but no fan spin yet

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
So your problem appears when 5V tries to come on.
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils.
Also check any other output power rail, and after Power FETs also.

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Well crap. Most of the big coils are 0.000V to ground. All the CPU coils it seems. So PCH is toast?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
CPU coils show very low value as normal; aprox 1 ohm for i7.

PCH coils and RAM have good value?
Check them for voltage pulse also.

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Ok just checked, CPU coils are around 1.5 ohms so should be ok

The one coil that stands out is 7260 which is a straight short to ground. Shall I inject and see what's up?

RAM coil numbers look good. Which one is PCH?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: I injected the line, found C6213 short. Removed. Short gone. Removed bridge on R7271 and MacBook now turns on WOOOO. thank you 2informaticos

threads.title: 820-3115 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Glad to hear is solved now.
